tit.e: Shingoshui Wakashu (New Later Collection of Gleanings)
Shingoshui Wakashu (New Later Collection of Gleanings)
tit.cmt: タイトルのため、補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 『新後拾遺和歌集』（しんごしゅういわかしゅう）は、勅撰和歌集。
sen.e: "Shingoshui Wakashu" is one of the Chokusen Wakashu (anthology of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command).
"Shingoshui Wakashu" is one of the Chokusen Wakashu (anthology of Japanese poetry compiled by the Imperial command).
"Shingoshui Wakashu" (New Later Collection of Gleanings) is one of the chokusen wakashu (anthology of Japanese poetry compiled by the Imperial command).
It consist of 20 volumes.
It consist of 20 volumes.
It consists of 20 volumes.
This is the twentieth collection of the Nijuichidai-shu (the twenty-one collections of waka compiled by imperial command).
This is the twentieth collection of the Nijuichidai-shu (the twenty-one collections of waka compiled by imperial command).
This is the 20th collection of the Nijuichidai-shu (the twenty-one collections of waka compiled by imperial command).

sen.j: 後円融院の永和 (日本)元年（1375年）6月29日、二条為遠が勅を奉じ、永徳元年（1381年）撰者死後、二条為重がおおせによりついで、同3年（1383年）10月28日成る。
sen.e: On August 5, 1375, during the reign of Goenyuin, Tameto NIJO received a command from the Emperor, and in 1381, after the death of the selectors, Tameshige NIJO was ordered to take over the work by the Emperor, and on December 1, 1383, it was completed.

On August 5, 1375, during the reign of Goenyuin, Tameto NIJO received a command from the Emperor, and in 1381, after the death of the selectors, Tameshige NIJO was ordered to take over the work by the Emperor, and on December 1, 1383, it was completed.

On August 5, 1375, during the reign of Goenyuin, Tameto NIJO received a command from the Emperor, and in 1381, after the death of the selectors, Tameshige NIJO was ordered to take over the work by the Emperor, and on December 1, 1383, it was completed.

sen.j: 永徳2年（1382年）筆の二条良基の序がある。
sen.e: It contains a foreword which was written by Yoshimoto NIJO in 1382.
It contains a foreword which was written by Yoshimoto NIJO in 1382.
It contains a foreword which was written by Yoshimoto NIJO in 1382.
The number of poems are 1554.
The number of poems are 1554.
The number of poems is 1554.

sen.j: 部立は、『続拾遺和歌集』にならった。
sen.e: It was made adopting the same categories as "Shoku Shui Wakashu" (12th imperial anthology).
It was made adopting the same categories as "Shoku Shui Wakashu" (12th imperial anthology).
It was made adopting the same categories as "Shoku Shui Wakashu" (12th imperial anthology).

sen.j: 二条家撰の最後の集である。
sen.e: Also, it was the last collection selected by the Nijo family.
Also, it was the last collection selected by the Nijo family.
Also, it was the last collection selected by the Nijo family.
